fig.title: - EGFR signaling is essential for c-Fos-dependent bone tumor formation.
fig.label: Figure 1
fig.sd-panel: X-ray analysis of 6-months-old H2-c-fosLTR/Egfrwa/+ and H2-c-fosLTR/Egfrwa/wa littermates. Scale bars: 1cm
Bone tumor number per mouse at 5-6 months of age (n=23 wa/+, 15 wa/wa)
Quantification of tumor size in tibiae at 5-6 months of age (n=23 wa/+, 15 wa/wa)
Alkaline Phosphatase (ALP) levels in the serum at endpoint (age = 5-6 months; n=16 wa/+, 11 wa/wa)
X-ray analysis before (age = 2 months) and after (age = 7 months) vehicle or Erlotinib treatment
Quantification of tumor number during treatment (n=6 Vehicle, 5 Erlotinib)
Tumor size during treatment (n=6 Vehicle, 5 Erlotinib)
Analysis of serum ALP levels during treatment (n=5)

PET summation images (0-90 min) in horizontal (upper panel) and coronal view (lower panel) depicting [11C]Erlotinib distribution in one H2-c-fosLTR/Egfrwt mouse (M125). Anatomical structures are labelled with arrows (T, tumor; L, liver; H, heart; B, brain). Scale bars: 1cm Concentration-time curves of [11C]Erlotinib in bone tumors in right scapula of three H2-c-fosLTR/Egfrwt mice measured with PET. Broken line indicates threshold for in vitro effect of Erlotinib (1 µM)

fig.title: - Osteoblast-specific EGFR deletion reduces c-Fos driven osteosarcoma formation.
fig.label: Figure 2
fig.sd-panel: X-ray analysis of 7-months-old H2-c-fosLTR/Egfrwt and H2-c-fosLTR/Egfr∆Ob littermates. Scale bars: 1cm
Bone tumor number per mouse at 6-7 months of age (n=22 wt, 11 ∆Ob) Quantification of tumor size in tibiae (n=22 wt, 11 ∆Ob)
ALP levels in the serum at 7-month endpoint (n=17 wt, 8 ∆Ob)

µPET/CT analysis of 7-months-old H2-c-fosLTR/Egfrwt and H2-c-fosLTR/Egfr∆Ob littermates Standardized uptake values (SUV) of the µPET-tracer Na[18F]F in the pelvic osteosarcoma of 4- and 7-months-old H2-c-fosLTR/Egfrwt and H2-c-fosLTR/Egfr∆Ob mice. n=6 wt, 4 ∆Ob for 4 month time-point, n=6 wt, 3 ∆Ob for 7 month time-point

fig.title: - EGFR is essential for proliferation, survival and c-Fos protein and mRNA expression via RSK2/CREB phosphorylation.
fig.label: Figure 3
fig.sd-panel: PCNA and cleaved Caspase 3 IHC staining and quantification shown as % positive cells (for PCNA) and as positive cells per mm² (for cleaved Caspase 3) in OS from H2-c-fosLTR/Egfrwt (n=6) and H2-c-fosLTR/Egfr∆Ob (n=5) mice. Scale bars: 100µm

Egfr, Ccnd1, c-fos and transgenic c-fos (c-fostg) mRNA expression levels in tumors of H2-c-fosLTR/Egfrwt and H2-c-fosLTR/Egfr∆Ob mice normalized to Tbp. n=17 wt, 14 ∆Ob (Egfr, Ccnd1), n=16 wt, 13 ∆Ob (c-fos), n=16 wt, 14 ∆Ob (c-fostg
IHC staining and quantification showing pRSK2 (n=4), pCREB (n=7 wt, 6∆Ob) and c-Fos (n=5) positive cells (%) in OS from H2-c-fosLTR/Egfrwt and H2-c-fosLTR/Egfr∆Ob littermates. Scale bars: 100µm

fig.title: - EGFR controls c-Fos via MAPK-dependent CREB activation in primary OS cells.
fig.label: Figure 4
fig.sd-panel: Western Blot analysis of primary OS cells isolated from H2‑c‑fosLTR/Egfrwt and H2-c-fosLTR/Egfr∆Ob mice
c-fos and transgenic c-fos (c fostg) mRNA expression levels in primary H2-c-fosLTR OS cells after 4x in vitro passages, cultured under standard conditions (n=3 independent cell lines)
Western Blot analysis of H2-c-fosLTR/Egfrwt OS cells treated for 24h with Erlotinib
c-fos and c-fostg mRNA expression levels in H2-c-fosLTR/Egfrwt OS cells treated for 24h with Erlotinib (10µM) or DMSO as control (n=4 independent cell lines)

Western Blot analysis of starved H2-c-fosLTR/Egfrwt OS cells, pre-treated with DMSO (1:1000), Afatinib (5µM), GSK2233470 (10µM), Rapamycin (10nM) or U0126 (10µM) for 30 minutes and stimulated with EGF (50ng/ml) as indicated
Western Blot analysis of primary OS cells isolated from a p53f/f Rb1f/f Osx-Cre mouse after 24h Erlotinib treatment
c-fos mRNA expression levels in p53f/f Rb1f/f Osx-Cre OS cells treated for 24h with Erlotinib (10µM) (n=3)
Western Blot analysis of starved p53f/f Rb1f/f Osx-Cre OS cells, pre-treated with DMSO (1:1000) or Afatinib (5µM) for 30 minutes and stimulated with EGF (50ng/ml) as indicated

fig.title: - Osteoblast-specific overexpression of the EGFR ligand Amphiregulin accelerates tumor formation in H2-c-fosLTR mice.
fig.label: Figure 5
fig.sd-panel: X-ray analysis of 6-months-old H2-c-fosLTR and H2-c-fosLTR/ColAREG littermates. Scale bars: 1cm
Bone tumor number per mouse at 5-6 months of age (n=22 wt, 13 ColAREG)
Quantification of tumor size in tibiae at 5-6 months of age (n=22 wt, 13 ColAREG)
Alkaline Phosphatase (ALP) levels in the serum at endpoint (age = 5-6 months; n=29 wt, 19 ColAREG)
c-fos mRNA expression levels in osteosarcomas of H2-c-fosLTR (n=11) and H2-c-fosLTR/ColAREG mice (n=14)
Western Blot analysis of bone tumor protein lysates from H2-c-fosLTR and H2-c-fosLTR/ColAREG mice

fig.title: - EGFR and c-Fos co-expression in human OS negatively correlates with patient survival.
fig.label: Figure 6
fig.sd-panel: Representative images of OS biopsies stained with antibodies against EGFR and c‑Fos. Scale bars: 50µm
Kaplan-Meier survival curve comparing the survival of patients with EGFR and c-Fos double positive osteosarcomas against patients without co-expression of both proteins. (n=52)
Gene expression correlation analysis of several cancer-associated RTKs with FOS in human OS (data analyzed from publicly available dataset E-GEOD-39058)

fig.title: - EGFR inhibition decreases tumor progression of human OS cells 143b after orthotopic injection.
fig.label: Figure 7
fig.sd-panel: Western Blot analysis showing EGFR and c-Fos protein levels in human OS cell lines cultured under standard conditions

Cell viability of 143b or LM7 cells cultured for 24h in medium (+10% FCS) with DMSO (1:2000) or Erlotinib (10µM) (n=3, representative result from 3 independent experiments, shown as fold change, normalized to DMSO)

Cell viability of 143b or LM7 cells cultured for 24h in medium (+0.5% FCS) containing 1xPBS (contr., 1:200) or EGF (50ng/ml) (n=3, representative result from 3 independent experiments, shown as fold change, normalized to control)

Treatment scheme: 143b OS cells (106 in 25µl PBS) were intratibially injected; mice were treated for 14 days with vehicle or Erlotinib (50mg/kg) 7 days after injection, when the tumors started to grow
143b xenograft growth curve during therapeutic regime (n=8 vehicle, 6 Erlotinib; two independent experiments) 143b tumor weight at endpoint (n=8 Vehicle, 6 Erlotinib; two independent experiments)

Treatment scheme: LM7 OS cells (106 in 25µl PBS) were intratibially injected; mice were treated for 21 days with vehicle or Erlotinib (50mg/kg) 42 days after injection, when the tumors started to grow
LM7 xenograft growth curve during therapeutic regime (n=7 Vehicle, 5 Erlotinib; two independent experiments) LM7 tumor weight at endpoint. n=7 vehicle, 5 Erlotinib, two independent experiment

IHC analysis of PCNA and cleaved Caspase 3 in 143b-derived tumors (n=4). Scale bars: 50µm IHC analysis of pCREB and c-Fos in 143b-derived tumors. (n=5 for pCREB and n=4 for c-Fos analysis). Scale bars: 50µm
Western Blot analysis of pCREB/CREB and p-c-Fos/c-Fos protein expression in lysates directly isolated from 143b xenografts at endpoint, after 14 days of vehicle or Erlotinib treatment
